meanings.definition: To climb up or down something quickly using both hands and legs.
meanings.sent1: She shinnied up the tree to get a better view of the park.
meanings.sent2: The cat shinnied down the fence to escape from the dog.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shinnied up the pole, showing off its acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: He shinnied down the rope like a skilled mountaineer.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter shinnied up the ladder to rescue the kitten from the tree.

meanings.definition: Past tense of the verb 'shinny', meaning to climb up or down something quickly using both hands and legs.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she shinnied up the rock wall at the gym.
meanings.sent2: The kids shinnied down the slide at the playground.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon shinnied up the drainpipe, looking for a snack on the roof.
meanings.sent4: He shinnied down the staircase in record time.
meanings.sent5: The hiker shinnied up the mountain, eager to reach the summit.
